text: Union Kleinmünchen Linz is a women soccer club from Linz, Upper Austria. It was founded in 1980 and was the first club, which is a pure women soccer club. The colours of the team are red and white. ==History== The club was founded in 1980 and started playing in the highest league. From 1980 till 2008 they played each season in the highest class. The season 2008/09 they played for the first time in the 2. league but next season (2009/10) they could reach the championship and were promoted to the ÖFB-Frauenliga. ==Honours== * Austrian Champion: 1990, 1991, 1992, 1993, 1994, 1996, 1998, 1999 * Austrian Cup: 1991, 1993, 1995, 1996, 1998, 1999 * Upper Austrian Champion: 1991, 1992, 1997, 1998, 1999, 2000, (Second squad) * Upper Austrian Cup: 2001 (Second squad) * ÖFB-Frauenliga runner-up: 1987, 1988, 1989, 1995, 1997, 2000, 2005 * Austrian Cupfinals: 1997, 2001, 2003 ==Other websites== *Union Kleinmünchen official homepage with statistics about Austrian women soccer(German) Category:Austrian football clubs Category:Women's football in Austria Category:Football clubs of Upper Austria Category:Linz Category:1980 establishments in Europe Category:1980s establishments in Austria
title: Union Kleinmünchen
